name: Pepin the Short
JA_events:
Pushed out powerless Merovingian king with blessing of Pope|
Donated Lombardi land to the pope, establishing Papal States|
Annointed Patrician of the Romans by Pope Stephen II

name: Carloman I
JA_events:
Received the eastern part of Pepin's lands|
Competed against Charlemagne for complete control of territory|
After death, Charlemagne annexed his territory as sole ruler

name: Charlemagne
JA_events:
Conquered and Christianized the Saxons and Frisians|
Invaded Italy on appeal from Pope, assuming Lombard crown|
Crowned Emperor of the Romans for securing Christian borders
JA_relationships: Lombards, Desiderius, Father-in-law, img/italy/desiderius.jpg

name: Louis the Pious
JA_events:
As king of Aquitaine, served as co-emperor with his father|
Attempted to keep empire together and repeal debauchery|
Upon his death, civil war broke out and empire split three ways
JA_relationships: Bavaria, Welf, Father-in-law, img/hre/welf_i.jpg

name: Charles the Bald
JA_events:
Received western part of father's empire inTreaty of Verdun|
Lost Brittany but won the Aquitaine and western Lorraine|
Crowned Emperor of the Romans after death of nephew Louis II

name: Louis II
JA_events:
Declined the crown of Emperor of the Romans|
Agreed to truce with ruler of East Francia, Louis the Younger|
After death, land divided between sons Carloman II and Louis III

name: Louis III
JA_events:
Received Neustria and Francia from father Louis II|
With brother Carloman II, repelled Scandinavian invaders|
Ceded western Lotharingia to Louis the Younger of East Francia

name: Carloman II
JA_events:
Received Burgundy & Aquitaine from father Louis II|
Tried unsuccessfully to defeat usurper of Provence, Boso

name: Charles the Fat
JA_events:
Received East Francia after death of brother, Louis the Younger|
Received West Francia after deaths of Louis and Carloman|
Seen as incompetent, deposed in East Francia by Arnulf

name: Odo
JA_events:
As Count of Paris, successfully defended against viking raiders|
Elected King of the Franks after deposition of Charles the Fat|
First king who was not of Merovingian or Carolingian blood

name: Charles III
JA_events:
Ceded Normandy to Vikings in return for conversion and fealty|
Received Lotharingia after death of Louis the Child|
Killed usurper Robert but taken prisoner by Robert's son-in-law

name: Robert I
JA_events:
Younger brother to Odo, defeated Northmen at Chartres|
Elected king with support of dissident nobles and East Francia|
Victorious at Battle of Soissons but killed in the battle

name: Rudolph
JA_events:
Son-in-law of Robert I, who was killed overthrowing Charles III|
Made peace with Normans, granting them the Channel Islands|
Lost Lorraine to Henry I and Laon to Herbert, captor of Charles

name: Louis IV
JA_events:
Spent his reign stuggling against vassal, Hugh the Great|
Defended against invasion by Hugh who had support of Otto I|
Captured and imprisoned by Hugh, who was excommunicated
JA_relationships:
England, Edward the Elder, Grandfather, img/england/edward_the_elder.jpg|
Germany, Otto I, Brother-in-law, img/hre/otto_i.jpg

name: Lothair III
JA_events:
Broke German alliance and spent reign fighting over Lorraine|
Attempted to capture Otto II's family, prompting German Invasion|
Defended with help of Hugh Capet, grandson of Hugh the Great
JA_relationships:
Saxony, Gerberga, Mother, img/hre/gerberga.jpg|
Holy Roman Empire, Otto I, Uncle, img/hre/otto_i.jpg|
Italy, Emma, Wife, img/italy/emma.jpg

name: Louis V
JA_events:
Married widow of Aquitaine but lost it and failed to retake it|
Unpopular uncle, Charles, passed over in favor of Hugh Capet|
Last Carolingian King of Francia

name: Hugh Capet
JA_events:
First of a direct line of 15 Capetian kings of France|
Son of Hugh the Great and grandson of Robert I|
Faced internal struggles, but son acceeded without difficulty
JA_relationships: Holy Roman Empire, Otto I, Uncle, img/hre/otto_i.jpg

name: Robert II
JA_events:
Brought Burgundy back under Frankish control for brief period|
Pressed claim to fiefs as they became vacant, consolidating hold
JA_relationships: Italy, Rozala, Wife, img/italy/rozala.jpg

name: Henry I
JA_events:
Favored then fought William the Conquerer, Duke of Normandy|
Signed decree of friendship with Henry III, Holy Roman Emperor|
Civil war fought with younger brother, who was given Burgundy
JA_relationships:
England, William the Conquerer, Nephew, img/england/william_the_conquerer.png|
Russia, Yaroslav the Wise, Father-in-law, img/russia/yaroslav.jpg

name: Philip I
JA_events:
Supported Robert Curthose, Duke of Normandy, against England|
Drawn into conflict with papacy for selling ecclesiastical positions|
Added the Vexin and Bourges to Frankish rule
JA_relationships: Flanders, Bertha, Wife, img/france/bertha.jpg

name: Louis VI
JA_events:
Contested the Vexin against Henry I of England|
Repelled German invasion, who marched under French banner|
Added Aquitaine to Francia by marrying Eleanor to his son

name: Louis VII
JA_events:
Marriage to Eleanor annulled, losing Aquitaine to England|
Fought Henry II, Duke of Normandy and later King of England|
Supported English Thomas Becket, Archbishop of Canterbury
JA_relationships:
Aquitaine, Eleanor, Wife, img/france/eleanor.jpg|
Castille, Constance, Wife, img/spain/constance.jpg

name: Philip II
JA_events:
Participated in Third Crusade with Richard I of England|
Reclaimed French land from Angevin Empire of John I|
Left France rich, paving the way for greatness in 13th century
JA_relationships: Denmark, Ingeborg, Wife, img/denmark/ingeborg.jpg

name: Louis VIII
JA_events:
Offered English throne by rebellious English barons|
Recaptured fortress of Avignon from Albigensian heretics|
Developed concept of fealty sworn to throne, not the individual
JA_relationships: Castille, Blanche, Wife, img/spain/blanche.jpg

name: Louis IX
JA_events:
Prevented English Henry III from reclaiming Angevin land|
Created provosts, bailiffs, and presumption of innocence|
Captured and ransomed during Seventh Crusade

name: Philip III
JA_events:
Annexed Toulouse to the French crown|
Married son to heiress of Navarre, Champagne, and Brie|
Fought the Aragonese, who opposed Angevin rule of Sicily
JA_relationships: Sicily, Charles I, Uncle, img/italy/charles_i.jpg

name: Philip IV
JA_events:
Fought England over Gascony and later Flanders for treachery|
Clement V, a Gascon, moved papacy from Rome to Avignon|
Attempted to have brother and son elected Holy Roman Emperor
JA_relationships: Navarre, Joan, Wife, img/spain/joan_navarre.jpg

name: Louis X
JA_events:
Married daughter of Burgundy, who he imprisoned for adultery|
Allowed serfs to buy freedom, beginning the end of serfdom|
Attempted to raise money through charters to fund Flemish war

name: John I
JA_events:
Born posthumously to Louis X|
Died 5 days after birth, with throne going to uncle Philip V

name: Philip V
JA_events:
Succession of Philip, over neice, set precedent for Salic law|
Created independent Court of Finances and single currency|
Created standardization of weights and measures

name: Charles IV
JA_events:
Invaded the Aquitaine, held by his vassal Edward II of England|
Failed in bid for German throne and acquisition of Flanders|
Died without heir, ending Capetian line, succeeded by cousin
JA_relationships:
England, Edward II, Brother-in-law, img/england/edward_ii.jpg|
Holy Roman Empire, Henry VII, Father-in-law, img/hre/henry_vii.jpg

name: Philip VI
JA_events:
Gave Artois to his kin, fomenting discontent among his nobles|
Resentment carried to Edward III, who had a claim to throne|
Purchased Dauphiné but left France divided by war and plague
JA_relationships: England, Edward III, Nephew, img/england/edward_iii.png

name: John II
JA_events:
Inherited English war, breaking a truce and then losing terribly|
Defeated and taken prisoner at Poitiers by The Black Prince|
Released for hostages, returned to England when one escaped
JA_relationships: Holy Roman Empire, Bonne, Wife, img/hre/bonne_of_luxembourg.jpg

name: Charles V
JA_events:
Treaty of Calais had granted southwestern France to Edward III|
Recaptured all ceded territories and dispossesed King of Navarre|
Support of Clement VII led to the great schism of the papacy

name: Charles VI
JA_events:
Attempted to install Avignon antipope Clement VII in Rome|
Went mad, after which Burgundy and Orleans vied for power|
After defeat at Agincourt, named Henry V of England his heir
JA_wars:
Hundred Years' War, 1337-1453|
Armagnac-Burgundian Civil War
JA_relationships: Holy Roman Empire, Isabeau, Wife, img/hre/isabeau_bavaria.jpg

name: Charles VII
JA_events:
Disinherited by father in favor of Henry V of England|
Reclaimed Paris and northern France with help of Joan of Arc|
Ended the civil war between houses of Valois and Orleans
JA_wars:
Hundred Years' War, 1337-1453|
Armagnac-Burgundian Civil War

name: Louis XI
JA_events:
Faced an alliance of Burgundy, Brittany, and England|
Dismantled alliance, finally killing Duke of Burgundy in battle|
Ended reign with Burgundy, Picardy, Boulonnais, and Artois
JA_relationships: Italy, Charlotte of Savoy, Wife, img/italy/charlotte_savoy.jpg

name: Charles VIII
JA_events:
Married Anne of Brittany to prevent encirclement by Habsburgs|
Forfeited Artois and Franche-Comté acquired through Margaret|
Pressed claim on Angevin Naples, triggering Italian Wars
JA_wars:
Mad War, France, 1485-8|
Italian Wars, Italy, 1494-8
JA_relationships:
Holy Roman Empire, Margaret of Austria, Betrothed, img/hre/margaret_of_austria.jpg|
Brittany, Anne, Wife, img/france/anne_of_brittany.jpg|
Naples, Marie of Anjou, Grandmother, img/italy/marie_of_anjou.jpg

name: Louis XII
JA_events:
Duke of Orleans, second-cousin and brother-in-law to king|
Conquered Milan but lost Naples to Ferdinand II of Aragon|
Defeated in Milan & Artois by Swiss and Burgundy by Henry VIII
JA_wars:
Second Italian War, 1499-1504|
Third Italian War, 1508-16
JA_relationships:
Brittany, Anne, Wife, img/france/anne_of_brittany.jpg|
England, Mary Tudor, Wife, img/england/mary_tudor.jpg

name: Francis I
JA_events:
Cousin and son-in-law to Louis XII, first of Angoulême branch|
Defeated Milan; with riches, copied an Italian renaissance court|
Imprisoned by Emperor Charles V, gave up Italy for his release
JA_relationships:
Scotland, James V, Son-in-law, img/scotland/james_v.jpg|
Italy, Duke of Savoy, Son-in-law, img/italy/emmanuel_of_savoy.jpg

name: Henry II
JA_events:
Developed a court system between local justices and high court|
Supported German Protestants against Emperor Charles V|
Systematically persecuted French Protestants
JA_relationships: Florence, Catherine de' Medici, Wife, img/italy/catherine_de_medici.jpg

name: Francis II
JA_events:
Used by the Guises, wife's uncle, to quell the Huguenot forces|
Faced capture by Huguenot Bourbons to end Guise influence|
Forced to sign Treaty of Edinburgh: end of Scottish influence
JA_relationships:
Scotland, Mary Queen of Scots, Wife, img/scotland/mary.jpg|
Florence, Catherine de' Medici, Mother, img/italy/catherine_de_medici.jpg

name: Charles IX
JA_events:
Planned intervention on behalf of Protestants against Spain|
Remained under influence of mother, Catherine de Medicis|
On her advice, allowed a massacre of 3,000 Protestants in Paris
JA_relationships:
Florence, Catherine de' Medici, Mother, img/italy/catherine_de_medici.jpg|
Holy Roman Empire, Maximilian II, Father-in-law, img/hre/maximillian_ii.jpg

name: Henry III
JA_events:
Placed on Polish throne by mother, resigned when brother died|
Holy League formed against Huguenot successor, Henry IV|
Forced by League, which had rebelled, into alliance with Henry
JA_wars:
French Wars of Religion, 1562-98|
War of the Three Henrys, 1587-9

name: Henry IV
JA_events:
First Bourbon, leader of Huguenot forces as King of Navarre|
Huguenots massacred on the day of his appeasement marriage|
Fought Holy League but converted to claim and unify the throne
JA_wars:
French Wars of Religion, 1562-98|
Franco-Spanish War, 1595-8|
Franco-Savoyard War, 1600-1
JA_relationships: Florence, Marie de Medici, Wife, img/italy/marie_de_medici.jpg

name: Louis XIII
JA_events:
While wars of religion had ended, still faced Huguenot rebellions|
Invading Italy, France entered Thirty Years War against Spain|
Defeated Spain, establishing France as a global superpower
JA_relationships: Spain, Anne of Austria, Wife, img/spain/anne_of_austria.jpg

name: Louis XIV
JA_events:
Extended eastern borders at the expense of Austrian Habsburgs|
Defeated hostile Spanish coalition to secure throne for grandson|
Known as the Sun King, led a revival of culture and grandeur
JA_wars:
Franco-Dutch War, 1672-8|
Nine Years' War, 1688-97|
War of the Spanish Succession
JA_relationships: Spain, Maria Theresa, Wife, img/spain/maria_theresa.jpg

name: Louis XV
JA_events:
Lost all colonial possessions in Americans and India to British|
Gained nothing from Austria or Russia during partition of Poland|
Through ineffective wars, set the stage for the French Revolution
JA_wars:
War of Polish Succession, 1733|
War of Austrian Succession, 1740|
Seven Years' War, 1756-1763
JA_relationships: Poland, Stanislaw I, Father-in-law, img/poland/stanislaw.jpg

name: Louis XVI
JA_events:
Financed American revolution, leaving country deeply in debt|
Forced to accept National Assembly and constitutional monarchy|
Soliciting intervention, convicted of treason by French Republic
JA_relationships:
Holy Roman Empire, Maria Josepha of Saxony, Mother, img/hre/maria_josepha.jpg|
Holy Roman Empire, Marie Antoinette, Wife, img/hre/marie_antoinette.jpg

name: Napoleon I
JA_events:
Rose from soldier to general to consul to emperor over 11 years|
Defeated series of coalitions, collapsing the Holy Roman Empire|
Lost army invading Russia, turning tide and was exiled to Elba
JA_relationships:
Spain, Joseph Bonaparte, Brother, img/spain/joseph_bonaparte.jpg|
Austria, Francis I, Father-in-law, img/hre/francis_ii.jpg

name: Louis XVIII
JA_events:
Exiled in revolution, wandered Europe promoting royalist cause|
As Napoleon fell, promised to honor the republic's reforms|
Restored by Talleyrand, coalition, and war-weary Parisians
JA_relationships: Savoy, Marie Josephine, Wife, img/italy/marie_josephine.jpg

name: Napoleon I
JA_events:
Frustrated by Bourbon Restoration and Congress of Vienna|
Escaped, gathered forces, and marched on Paris to applause|
Defeated at Waterloo by coalition and banished to St. Helena
JA_relationships:
Spain, Joseph Bonaparte, Brother, img/spain/joseph_bonaparte.jpg|
Austria, Francis I, Father-in-law, img/hre/francis_ii.jpg

name: Louis XVIII
JA_events:
Fled during the Hundred Day's War, returning after Waterloo|
Gave Parliament control over laws and budget with his approval|
Resisted the ultraroyalists in favor of healing the country
JA_relationships: Savoy, Marie Josephine, Wife, img/italy/marie_josephine.jpg

name: Charles X
JA_events:
Reimposed death penaly for sacrilege during first government|
In second government, supported ultraroyalist clericalists|
Deposed, naming grandson heir and Louis-Philippe general
JA_relationships: Savoy, Marie Theresa, Wife, img/italy/marie_therese.jpg

name: Louis Philippe I
JA_events:
Popular with republicans and Bonaparists, given a vacant throne|
Seen as a citizen king, favored the bourgeoisie over aristocracy|
Refusing any election reform, deposed in 1848 wave of socialism
JA_relationships: Belgians, Leopold I, Son-in-law, img/belgians/leopold_i.jpg

name: Napoleon III
JA_events:
Elected President of Second Republic after Revolution of 1848|
Declared himself Emperor under the Second French Empire|
Deposed after defeat in the Franco-Prussian War
